options.label: B
options.text: Alert and action lines are separated by a difference of 4 hours

A 38 week primigravida presented to the labor room with minimal labor pains and contraction. On examination, the cervix is 2 cm dilated and 50% effaced. The heart rate of the patient is 86/min and blood pressure is 126/76 mm Hg. What should be done next?

options.label: B
options.text: Observe the patient and wait for increase in uterine contractions

options.label: C
options.text: Sedate the patient by and give Phenergan to decease labor pains

options.label: D
options.text: Induce labor by artificial rupture of membranes

questions.correct_answer: B. Observe the patient and wait for increase in uterine contractions

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding medical abortion?

options.label: A
options.text: Can only be done upto 72 days

options.label: B
options.text: Ultrasound should be done in all cases

options.label: C
options.text: Only a person certified under MTP act can perform medical termination of pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: If the patient has an IUCD in –situ, it doesen’t need to be removed

questions.correct_answer: C. Only a person certified under MTP act can perform medical termination of pregnancy

questions.text: Rh-negative mother, ICT negative was given Anti D during 28 weeks of pregnancy. Which of the following is the ideal one?

options.text: Give another dose of Anti D 72 hour postpartum irrespective of baby blood group

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: A. Give another dose of Anti D 72 hour postpartum depending on the baby blood group

questions.text: Contraindications of pregnancy include? (PGI TYPE)

options.label: C
options.text: Marfan syndrome with dilated aortic root of 5 cm

questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Marfan syndrome with dilated aortic root >45 mm Coarctation of aorta Eisenmenger syndrome/Severe pulmonary hypertension NYHA class 3 and 4 LV ejection fraction <30%
  • • Marfan syndrome with dilated aortic root >45 mm
  • • Coarctation of aorta
  • • Eisenmenger syndrome/Severe pulmonary hypertension
  • • NYHA class 3 and 4
  • • LV ejection fraction <30%
  • • Severe fixed lesion like severe MS, AS etc
